posts.post_content:
A few years ago. we had a cool thread called "T206 Traders".  I don't why it died, but I always liked it.  So, I decided to bring it back.  

Everyone who has T206 for trade can post in this thread.  Remember to look at the date of each post before contacting the poster to discuss a trade.  If the post is old, keep in mind that they may not have the card(s) anymore.


I'm just going to post a bunch of pictures of stuff I have to trade.  I also have some graded HOFers that I don't have scans of at the moment.  The big picture at the bottom has a few cards in it that are not available, but most would be for the right item.

***I have sold/traded almost all of the cards that were pictured in this post as of 11/26/14***
Nice cards Luke, but I don't have any of the cards you listed...interested in anything else in trade?

Hi,

Looking to trade 4 T206 beaters to hopefully add to my set.  I am not looking right now to trade them individually rather looking to trade all four for 3-4 equivalent low grade cards I require.  PM me if you are interested and I can let you know what I need.

The Hoffman card has a "CALDWELL" stamp on the back.

Cheers,

Andy

[url]andysargent1@hotmail.com[/url]
I love this idea.  Willing to hear any trade possibilities on this Demmitt Tolstoi (can send scans via email if anyone cares, i'm not smart enough to get larger sized scans here):

My collection stands at 517/518, needing Elberfield, Washington, portrait, so that's first on my list.  But as that's unlikely, I'm also continually upgrading my collection, and I'd be interested in many different cards in Good or better condition, particularly hall-of-famers.

I also have 70-80 variously graded [from 1-5] cards, so if you have anything I like I may be able to accommodate you beyond what I've posted.  I prefer ungraded cards and am also in the process of replacing my slabbed ones.

Luke Lyons, if you still have that Merkle portrait, I'd like to trade for it.  In any event, let me know what you still have available.

Of course, I hope to hear from you other traders out there as well.  Bump this thread, or email [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url].  You can pm me, too, but I prefer email.

I should add that the first to say he'll take a card [via trade or sale] gets it.

Happy Thanksgiving.

Doug

Update: Kelley, Willis, batting, Chase, Stone, both Mannings, and Wiltse have been traded. 
Atz, Groom, Phelps have been sold, as have Maddox, Bridwell, McGann, Jackson, Conroy, Tannehill, Nicholls, Lindaman, Pfeister, Chase (top middle), and Frill.

GREAT Idea Luke (who I had many happy transactions).

Here's a link to my (sg713) ebay selling page:  [url]http://www.ebay.com/sch/sg713/m.html?item=371153290372&ssPageName=STRK%3AMESELX%3AIT&rt=nc&_trksid=p2047675.l2562[/url]

I would much, much, much :) rather Trade them than Sell them.

PMs are fine, but emails preferred:  [url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]

Thanks, Scott

The thread has been renamed in honor of Doug, one of the guys who made the original thread a success.  I think it has a certain je ne sais quoi :D

I have a couple Mattys and a Speaker that have had a rough life.  I'm looking to trade them for nicer condition HOFers, tougher back HOFers (condition not as important), or Sov150 or Old Mills from the 150/350 series that I need.  The Rucker is available for another Sov150 portrait or one of the aforementioned Old Mills.

I love talking trade, so please contact me if you are interested in any of these.
Doug, email sent.  LMK!

Thanks, Luke.

and Scott--good trade!
Doug, thanks so much for the deal!
traded

I'm adding this Eddie Collins to my trading list.--Update--Eddie has been TRADED--
The two two oversized cards are On Hold, being offered in a trade.

23 of original 42 still available; see updated trading list and scans in post #5.

Good luck to all, Scott

It may take some head scratching to complete this equation {x common = y hof} but it's probably doable.

Thanks, Scott

For anyone in need of an already-graded Mike Mitchell, I will trade for a similar beater, graded or not.  I only have 125/524 so need quite a few. 

For those interested in quirky marks this one was at one time marked 75 cents on the back in pencil.  Clearly that was not done any time recently and also was done at a time when writing the price of the card on the back was acceptable...

Here's a random bunch of stuff I have for trade.  I'm looking for HOFers with nice eye-appeal.  I prefer crease-free, but they can have a couple creases and still look nice.  Raw or graded are both fine.  Also looking for portraits from the 150/350 series with Sov150, EPDG, and Old Mill backs.  If you have something I'm looking for with a tougher back, condition is much less important to me.  

Shoot me a PM if you have anything to discuss.
